title: Kate Middleton 'sent awkward email to pals' as she prepared to join royal family
text:
Sign up to FREE daily email alerts from mirror - Royal Family Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Kate Middleton sent an awkward email to friends as she prepared to join the royal family, according to a royal expert.

Columnist Adam Helliker, a writer on celebrities, society and the Royal Family, says the Duchess asked her friends to stop calling her Kate two years before she got married.

Helliker claims she asked that pals instead referred to her as Catherine in 2008, before Prince William had even proposed.

The request is said to have been made via an email.

Many expected William was about to pop the question to his long-term girlfriend as Kate had recently been to William's RAF graduation and attended a wedding in his place.

(Image: Getty Images)

At the time, Helliker told the Sunday Express: "With Prince William’s engagement now a surefire certainty (even Ladbrokes has stopped taking bets on whether it will happen after a flurry of well-placed wagers) there are intriguing signs that Kate Middleton is preparing for her future role.

"It looks like she’s taking it very seriously indeed too.

"I hear that in the past few weeks the former accessories buyer has quietly informed friends that she would like to drop the informal ‘Kate’ and in future wishes to be known by her full name: 'Catherine'.”

(Image: Getty Images)

According to royal expert Daniela Elser, the request was made via email in a gentle and 'jokey' manner even though it was a bit awkward.

Her friends were apparently slightly taken aback.

Prince Charles' press secretary Paddy Harverson denied the reports.

(Image: - WPA Pool/Getty Images)

It is believed William would have called her Kate back in university when they started dating, but that her full name fit in more with the royal family.

William proposed to Kate in 2010 and the wedding took place the following year.
meta_description: Columnist Adam Helliker says the Duchess of Cambridge asked her friends to stop calling her Kate two years before she got married as she prepared for her future role
